content: hey crafters damn Scottie here good to have you with me today I'm going to show
you a little progress I'm making on our contest winner Ajay's crypt I've done a
little work with the hot wire foam factory tools and I want to show you
what I came up with I have a video detailing those tools if you're
interested so let's go to the table and I'll show you what I've got going on hey
guys I wanted to show you a bit of progress I was making on AJ's crypt I'm
going to do a little bit of interesting stuff with some foam excuse me so this
is that secret passage that is going from one in one room but I didn't I
didn't want to cut it just the secret passage because I figured it would it
would warp easily so what I thought it'd be kind of cool would be to light leave
this part and then take a piece of foam that I cut and use it for the sandstone
layer so this is going through the sandstone rock and I thought that'd be
kind of neat to show that on the tile and then I've got the other tile I'll
have it the same I'll do the same thing with that so I have like the sandstone
rock so those are the ones I've cut from the pink foam and they're all ready to
paint so I'll go ahead and paint those I also wanted to do the entrance so let me
show you what I got there I got a face that I made just out of cardboard and I
painted it with the sandstone texture now here's the cave entrance that I made
not to go along with it so that'll go here like this and then I'm gonna have
this piece that I cut cave entrance so it'll be going here and that'll lead
into the cave itself I also cut a little bit of a few pieces that I was going to
put on on the front I've had a little a real rock that I was going to put there
and one on top and then I had one more
that's gonna have their so what I'm gonna do now is I'll go ahead and I'm
gonna go ahead and paint base paint those brown and then I'm gonna paint him
up like I did the sandstone on the entrance tile when I did the
transitional tile so I'll come back and show you what those look like here's the
front part of the cave all painted up and there's a figure four scale so you
can see what it dependent looks like they're pretty sweet let me give you a
closer look here so this was a like I said this was carved out of the hot wire
foam factory and I just used the same colors I used for the when I did the
blending of the two tiles so I used the cinnamon and then a like tan to bring
out some highlights so then that fits to the on the entryway there and there we
go looking great I also want to show you something else I did I did the secret
passages and here's how I here's how I employed those pieces of styrofoam I
wanted to make it like here's the this the five foot wide secret passage and
this is like the sandstone that's in that's you know behind this wall here so
I thought that was a neat idea so I could keep this tile from buckling
because it's so small the passageways so small that so that but it was kind of a
trick I could use to just make it also look neat but kind of give it some
strength and then I did there's two passages so I did one for each side with
the sandstone embedded in the wall and this is just goes to the end it doesn't
go past the end of the tile so that'll fit nicely up against the crypt itself
so there we go there's those two things I was working on and I'll show you some
more here soon on AJ's crypt hey crafters I hope you've enjoyed this
episode of the DMS craft make sure to subscribe and I have tons of other
videos as you can see I am the originator of the 2.5 D method of
crafting tiles I also do dirt cheap terrain from the table if all this
intrigues you make sure you check out all the videos below also join my forum
we have lots of great crafters on there who give advice I have a link above and
below and last but not least remember go forth and craft
you
